content: Upon stabilization, we expect the property to generate 50% higher RevPAR and a near doubling of hotel EBITDA from pre-pandemic stabilized levels, effectively closing the performance gap with the properties competitive set, which has also experienced meaningful capital investment in recent years. So again, it's a little early to talk about next year disruption, but there's a good amount of disruption in this year, just because of the fact that we're going to start working on the meeting space, which is obviously limiting highest ability to really put a lot of group business on the books for a second half of the year.
